documents.document: @johnodee @fiannafailparty @DonnellyStephen I am not interested in your allegiances, if any
@johnodee @fiannafailparty @DonnellyStephen Please balance your original argument. Fact remains that FG are in lower 7 years now. Name a significant healthcare achievement in those 7 years.

@johnodee @fiannafailparty @DonnellyStephen So you now accept they have done some good for health - only that was a function of how much they were paid at the time. If you had a bit more balance in your opening position you may have had a veneer of credibility.
@johnodee @fiannafailparty @DonnellyStephen Cancer, cardio, stroke care, smoking ban all changed for the better under FF. #factcheck
@POTUSDonaldT @fiannafailparty @DonnellyStephen @carolmurr33 @mhicmhathuna Get used to minority Governments and different versions of confidence & supply agreements #realitycheck
@JackKavanagh12 @SocDems You mean “loss”…you lose

@andymcgeady Prediction. No ban. Chest to head. Dynamic situation. No deliberate act.

@chairmandec @killianbyrne Compare the cards Leinster got to the one Murray & ones Castres didn’t get. Munster stuttered to victory against 14/13. The media will hype it up but it was a false dawn from where I was watching. That fact will be lost in the next 48 hours and then columnists will call it out.

@chairmandec @killianbyrne Stating he was a Leinster fan would have been spot on, not ex-prez of the olsc. You and I don’t wave our rugby credentials around as a means of claiming respect on social media
@chairmandec @killianbyrne I refer you to my reply to the ex-prez of the olsc
@killianbyrne Yes I did. Such was the incompetence of your remark. Bested me arse. Thank you for taking the time to interact with me mr ex-president

@chairmandec @killianbyrne Yes. We did beat ourselves Dec. They were marginal and non-malicious disciplinary issues that wouldn’t have seen cards last season. Murray should have had one. At least Munster retaliated tonight unlike in Castres. Munster cannot be happy with their performance versus 14/13
@MaxDeegan Keep Learning & Keep the Faith. Great Cameo today ⚔️

@killianbyrne Your former OLSC role is irrelevant. Munster were poor given their numerical advantage for 75% of the game. Leinster indiscipline was the beginning, middle and end of the match. You couldn’t judge Munster’s performance other than by the margin of victory - intercept and all

@killianbyrne What an exaggeration. We beat ourselves. Period. Your two best players were born and learnt their trade in Leinster. He HAD to win tonight. Back it up by qualifying for the PRO14 play-offs.

@threeredkings Totally hysteria from Munster fans here. Lowe was reckless and pulling out in a non-malicious incident. Furlong got Colete’s head accidentally with his chest in a clear-out. Murray scragged Larmour worse than anything Healy did. Grow up kids. Enjoy your win, such that it was.

@James_White__ @threeredkings @chjones9 @ugomonye @TheRugbyPod I can’t see anything clearly there and nothing deliberate. What are te claiming happened and where is your evidence…because this is inadmissible
@AnMailleach @leinsterrugby Bullying kids. Not good 😜

@CiaranWest @eirSport @TommyBowe14 @lukefitz11 @Munsterrugby @leinsterrugby @PRO14Official Easily triggered aren’t you? To be clear. Munster were the better team on the night but commentators, like Donners on @eirSport (where this started), need to get some perspective on what that match was. 15 v 14/13 and struggled to own the game despite that. Do YOU do get that?
@paulhayesman Glad to hear you have taken to wearing underwear at last PH
@CiaranWest @eirSport @TommyBowe14 @lukefitz11 @Munsterrugby @leinsterrugby @PRO14Official Enjoy your cryptic self pleasuring. I am sure we will see you win Silverware this season.

@CiaranWest @eirSport @TommyBowe14 @lukefitz11 @Munsterrugby @leinsterrugby @PRO14Official Mate? Have we met? We all love each other dahling but we are passionate about our teams. Especially derby games #passiveaggressivemearse #pseudointellectualBS
@paulhayesman Were you hedging your bets?

@CiaranWest @eirSport @TommyBowe14 @lukefitz11 @Munsterrugby @leinsterrugby @PRO14Official Clever boyo. Murray should have been off for worse tackle than Healy. You still struggled to beat 14 but for a late intercept off a 20 year old. Munster are world beaters after that. Is that 2 wins in 12? Happy Christmas 🎄

@eirSport @TommyBowe14 @lukefitz11 Lads, lads, lads…some perspective please 15 man @Munsterrugby beat 14 man @leinsterrugby on the back of some marginal non-malicious plays. Donners totally OTT - should have won by 20+ didn’t. Fooling nobody #MUNvLEI @PRO14Official

The Government doesn’t enforce the existing carbon tax on solid fuel & so is driving the Black market & more pollutant fuels so it made no sense to increase it until it does so #TodaySOR #Budget @SolidFuelGroup

@EmmaLaneS @DonnellyStephen Getting there. His intent was to ensure that the legislation could not be legally challenged, NOT to delay the bill with bad intent. Do you acknowledge that and apologize for your false accusation?
@EmmaLaneS @DonnellyStephen Your unresearched public accusations of shenanigans against Stephen were thoroughly debunked hours ago, yet you have not yet apologised.
@DonnellyStephen @EmmaLaneS Looks like an apology is in order.

He also attended a meeting in Wicklow Town on Greenways
Getting ready for snap election? #rtept #Tonight

@peter_dooley Going really well this season. No limits.
@JackoRugby You forgot Karol Wojtyla & Luciano Pavarotti
@RisteardCooper @SpinalIreland Hill? That’s flatter than Amsterdam…not a snow capped peak in sight man? #onyerbike
@thepaulwilliams Way past his bedtime!
RT @walkwhileyoucan: The @walkwhileyoucan team have arrived into Munster! Heading from north Clare to west Cork. Looking forward to the Mun…
@RisteardCooper I tried, they were sold out in my size! #giantofaman
@OTTYSleep @JoeTomane29 An Irish mattress is what you need for Irish nights! A few pints of Guinness is all Joe needs #medicinal @leinsterrugby
@RisteardCooper And there you are…still in your fluorescent thong from Ibiza ‘90, fairly filling it now mind 🙄
@oisoftheclears @BHHooker @SamCane7 Not slow. But not as fast as he should be. Great in every other way. Pocock very limited in attack. SOB better. Leavy best rugby IQ along with dirty Sam Cane
@PhdMurphy @threeredkings POM has 1 big game in 5 & is a defensive player. SOB, Leavy, VDF, Beirne have better attack & are more consistent. POM is unreal at lineout
@DonnellyStephen @HIVIreland Who are the 2 old guys at the table?

@BHHooker @oisoftheclears Regrettably that is not possible with his shortage of pace. He has everything else. He runs on his heels, needs to work with an athletics coach to try and get another metre. @SamCane7 is the best World 7 IMHO but he is a dirty bugger especially in the tackle
@BHHooker Is it just me or is Sam a cynical and illegal tackler who starts at the shoulder and moves up with straight arms 9/10?

@ruggerblogger @SamCane7 adding to his burgeoning international reputation as a talented but dirty & cynical rugby player. Just search his name & read the stream after today. Is every1 else wrong & our eyes defective? Clean up your act Sam or you will soon be a liability #NZLvFRA
@OvalDigest Yep. Not alone in that. Another mucker of mine who played to a high level said the same thing. You haven’t told me why you thought their attack was slick

@threeredkings So why is POM (who was red hot today) a guaranteed starter if all are fit (Tadhg, SOB & Ruddock)? Lineout? If you or I were passed the ball as much as CJ is we would also be top passers - he is a bottleneck. If he develops footwork & sleight of hand I would reconsider my view
@Murray_Kinsella @threeredkings Anyone prepared to give him an Honorary Doctorate based on previous incidents of misdiagnosis?…didn’t think so

@threeredkings But he needs to be “James Ryan” consistent with those performances because his lack of carrying threat and overall ballast means he can’t command a place. Neither can Stander due to lack of distribution nous. No backrower is nailed on for RWC IMHO…which is good…to a degree

RT @threeredkings: That pass from Murray.
Just excellent https://t.co/eirsfEs39D
RT @threeredkings: WARNING: The following content contains a tighthead prop running over a scrumhalf. https://t.co/R3gy12eopQ
@threeredkings Probably. The extent to which the Aussies were hitting off the ball, pinning guys down, holding onto legs was off the charts.
@threeredkings Did Haley-Petty put his knees into Conway in a dirty way? Is there a clean way? Is it citable?
@OvalDigest Couldn’t be any worse than last week. I am talking about our attack. No creativity from our Centre plays. Ringrose being used mainly as a battering ram.
@OvalDigest Yes, but I want to see Farrell too. His two appearances in 6N were eye opening. Farrell & Ringrose? Aki #4 for me
@OvalDigest Yes but we should be much more fluid in mid-field than we are. Lack of interplay between forwards an issue as it would create more space/ slow their defensive line
@ouchitsfrancie @mikebreakfast It’s the Joe/perfectionist in me! 🙄
@ouchitsfrancie @mikebreakfast Close but no cigar - try Tighg (as in thigh but no h and a soft g at the end - simple!!)
@MattRCNM Get off the fence and call it Matt 😜
@thematiesdoc It’s Conor…as in Murray 😜
@thematiesdoc Good luck today!
@thematiesdoc More context please
@greham74 Franks does no more than Tadhg in set piece but can’t match him in open field. That said the Aussie sub right head, the Tongan Thor, might challenge him
@IndoSport Ridiculously generous ratings. Good win but should have won by 10+ points for all the possession and territory (both over 60%)

You have to ask why with all the skills our 10, 12. 13 axis has - are they playing without fluency? I think our feeds need to (be allowed?) interplay to draw their defence more & crest room for r backs @IrishRugby @threeredkings @OvalDigest @BrianODriscoll @offtheball #AUSvIRL
@Cailtegdfc James Ryan worthy too
@greham74 Who is better?

Ireland have now had 4 tries disallowed in 2 tests. Only 1 was clear cut correct decision (McGrath double movement). Earls scored today. @threeredkings @OvalDigest @offtheball @BrianODriscoll @IrishRugby #AUSvIRL #Ireland #Australia #rugby
Watch the Australians hold on to and pin down the Irish systematically as per 1st test…and score #AUSvIRL @WorldRugby

@ruggerblogger @JackoRugby @pdss9 @WorldRugby Cane is a class player but the evidence shows he has a cynical edge which Pocock and Leavy don’t. Facts are facts. If he plays hard but clean he will have my respect

@ruggerblogger @JackoRugby @pdss9 @WorldRugby Watch Dan Leavy tomorrow. He has a defensive & offensive game (which Pocock doesn’t have). Also lionhearted. Might be short a yard of pace. Let’s see how he goes. Schoolmate of our new Eales/Retallick, 21 yo James Ryan who plays at 5 and lost his 1st pro game in 25 last week.
Great to see a big crowd in Deerpark to support Fr Tony Coote’s 1st @walkwhileyoucan initiative for Motot Neuron Disease research https://t.co/eXrNOxUzy4
@MarianRTE is there anything good to be said about men at all? Are men just intrinsically bad?
@KevDoyle_Indo No. It suggests MM knows the mood of the people and is leading his party in that direction. It’s a process. But they need to pick up the pace. Big time
@JackoRugby A lot of bitter Welsh supporters on here. I agree Sexton is best all round 10 since DC
@craigthomas1 @JackoRugby @scarlets_rugby Oh stop whining!
